subtitle: A sweet and salty basted chicken stuffed with an apricot and pistachio nut stuffing.

method.text: To make the stuffing: Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the leek and garlic and saute together for 3 min or until softened. Remove from heat and leave to cool slightly.
Stir the breadcrumbs, sultana, apricot and pistachio nuts into the leek mixture. Add enough beaten egg to bind to a soft but not sticky stuffing. Season to taste.

Use the stuffing to stuff the neck end only of the chicken. Ensure you don't overfill the chicken as the skin could burst. Reserve any leftover stuffing. Place the onion and lemon quarters inside the body cavity.
Fold the skin under the chicken, or, if preferred sew up the skin with fine kitchen string and truss the bird. Weigh the stuffed chicken and then place on a rack in a roasting tin.
In a small saucepan, gently heat together the orange juice, honey and soy sauce until smooth and well mixed. Brush liberally over the chicken.
Calculate the cooking time, allowing 20 min per 450 g plus an extra 20 min at the end. Cook for the calculated time, which should be approx. 1 hour 20 min, basting frequently with the honey mixture.
Roll any leftover stuffing into small balls and cook alongside the chicken for the last 30 min of cooking time, until crisp, golden and piping hot.
Serve the chicken on a warmed serving plate with the stuffing balls to accompany.

title: Fruity stuffed honey roast chicken
